t: Job 31
Job Asserts His Integrity
“I*pn have made a covenant with my eyes; How*ln then could I gaze at a virgin?
And*ln what is the portion of God from above Or*ln the heritage of the Almighty from on high?
Is*ln it not calamity to the unjust And*ln disaster to those who work iniquity?
Does*ln He not see my ways And*ln number all my steps?
“If*ln I have walked with falsehood, And*ln my foot has hastened after deceit,
Let*ln Him weigh me with accurate scales, And*ln let God know my integrity.
If*ln my step has turned from the way, Or*ln my heart followed my eyes, Or*ln if any spot has stuck to my hands,
Let*ln me sow and another eat, And*ln let my crops be uprooted.
“If*ln my heart has been enticed by a woman, Or*ln I have lurked at my neighbor’s doorway,
May*ln my wife grind for another, And*ln let others kneel down over her.
For*ln that would be a lustful crime; Moreover,*ln it would be an iniquity punishable*i by*i judges.
For*ln it would be fire that consumes to Abaddon, And*ln would uproot all my increase.
“If*ln I have despised the claim of my male or female slaves When*ln they filed a complaint against me,
What*ln then could I do when God arises? And*ln when He calls me to account, what will I answer Him?
Did*ln not He who made me in the womb make him, And*ln the same one fashion us in the womb?
“If*ln I have kept the poor from their*i desire, Or*ln have caused the eyes of the widow to fail,
Or*ln have eaten my morsel alone, And*ln the orphan has not shared it
(But*ln from my youth he grew up with me as with a father, And*ln from infancy I guided her),
If*ln I have seen anyone perish for lack of clothing, Or*ln that the needy had no covering,
If*ln his loins have not thanked me, And*ln if he has not been warmed with the fleece of my sheep,
If*ln I have lifted up my hand against the orphan, Because*ln I saw I had support in the gate,
Let*ln my shoulder fall from the socket, And*ln my arm be broken off at the elbow.
For*ln calamity from God is a terror to me, And*ln because of His majesty I can do nothing.
“If*ln I have put my confidence in*i gold, And*ln called fine gold my trust,
If*ln I have gloated because my wealth was great, And*ln because my hand had secured so*i much;
If*ln I have looked at the sun when it shone Or*ln the moon going in splendor,
And*ln my heart became secretly enticed, And*ln my hand threw a kiss from my mouth,
That*ln too would have been an iniquity calling*i for*i judgment, For*ln I would have denied God above.
“Have*ln I rejoiced at the extinction of my enemy, Or*ln exulted when evil befell him?
No,*ln I have not allowed my mouth to sin By*ln asking for his life in a curse.
Have*ln the men of my tent not said, ‘Who*ln can find one who has not been satisfied with his meat’?
The*ln alien has not lodged outside, For*iln I have opened my doors to the traveler.
Have*ln I covered my transgressions like Adam, By*ln hiding my iniquity in my bosom,
Because*ln I feared the great multitude, And*ln the contempt of families terrified me, And*ln kept silent and did not go out of doors?
Oh*ln that I had one to hear me! Behold,*ln here is my signature; Let*ln the Almighty answer me! And*ln the indictment which my adversary has written,
Surely*ln I would carry it on my shoulder, I*ln would bind it to myself like a crown.
I*ln would declare to Him the number of my steps; Like*ln a prince I would approach Him.
“If*ln my land cries out against me, And*ln its furrows weep together;
If*ln I have eaten its fruit without money, Or*ln have caused its owners to lose their lives,
Let*ln briars grow instead of wheat, And*ln stinkweed instead of barley.” The*p words of Job are ended.
